alert.note: Alert for John Day Basin; Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Ochoco-John Day Highlands; Wallowa County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 03 at 11:38PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...RISES ON STREAMS AND RIVERS WILL CONTINUE DUE TO SNOWMELT AND PRECIPITATIOON... Streams and rivers emanating from the mountains will continue to see rises over the weekend. The low in California sending wrap-around moisture into the region, along with warm temperatures, will lead to rises in streams and rivers with several gauges forecasted to meet or exceed bankfull over the weekend. John Day River at at Service Creek is expected to go to moderate by Saturday and will continue to be monitored. The Naches at Cliffdell and Naches, Grande Ronde at Troy, and Imnaha at Imnaha have already risen above bankfull and are expected to reach minor flood stage over the weekend. The Yakima River at Umtanum and Kiona, the Grande Ronde at Perry, and North Fork at John Day are expected to reach action stage over the weekend. Widespread flooding is currently not anticipated. This Hydrologic Outlook will be updated in the afternoon with any pertinent updates concerning the latest flood forecast.

area.areaDesc: John Day Basin; Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Ochoco-John Day Highlands; Wallowa County
